Getting Started

Install using NPM

Vue.js can be installed using NPM (Node Package Manager). You will need to have this installed before you can install Vue.js. NPM is the recommended installation method when building large scale applications with Vue.js, as it pairs nicely with tools such as Webpack or Browserify.

An official CLI (Command-line Interface) is provided by Vue.js to quickly scaffold the structure of Single Page Applications (SPA). The CLI provides the setup for a modern frontend workflow.

When you create a project using the Vue.js CLI, a package.json file is already created within the project folder.

Open the terminal and enter the following commands to install Vue.js using NPM and the Vue.js CLI. Remember that the '$' symbols are there to indicate a terminal command and do not need to be entered. Vue.js will be installed globally allowing the 'vue' command to be used within the terminal in any directory.

Here, the project folder is named 'my-project'.

                        

# Install latest stable version of Vue.js
$ npm install vue
# Install vue-cli
$ npm install vue-cli --global
# Create a new project named 'my-project' using the 'webpack' template
$ vue init webpack my-project

# Install dependencies
$ cd my-project
$ npm install
# Run
$ npm run dev

Running the application

To run the application locally during development, open the terminal and enter the following commands. Your application should be running locally here: http://localhost:8081

                        

# Open the directory containing your project
$ cd my-project
# Run
$ npm run dev

File Structure

Once Vue.js has been installed, the file structure of your project should look something like the example (below). Most development work will take place within the 'src' directory.

                        

.eslintrc.js
.gitignore
.postcssrc.js
build/
    build.js
    check-versions.js
    logo.png
    utils.js
    vue-loader.conf.js
    webpack.base.conf.js
    webpack.dev.conf.js
    webpack.prod.conf.js
config/
    dev.env.js
    index.js
    prod.env.js
    test.env.js
index.html
node_modules/
package.json
README.md
src/
    App.vue
    assets/
        logo.png
    components/
        HelloWorld.vue
    main.js
    router/
        index.js
static/
test/
